poem:
**Concert of Silence**

From Germany to Ghent,  
notes halt mid-air—  
politics pirouette,  
shadowing the baton.  
  
In the stillness,  
an orchestra waits,  
as borders of sound  
become lines of division.  
  
Music mourns,  
an unplayed symphony,  
where silence  
screams louder than song.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Festival axes German orchestra over concerns about Israeli conductor A Belgian classical music festival has axed a leading German orchestra from its programme over concerns about its Israeli conductor, drawing accusations of antisemitism from Berlin. Flanders Festival Ghent announced it had cancelled a concert by the Munich Philharmonic scheduled for 18 September, citing insufficient clarity over Lahav Shani’s attitude to the Israeli government. Shani, who is the music director of the Israel Philharmonic, was expected". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
